Description: Squat, bulbous vase of red pottery: with a rounded base. The sides converge at the top to a contracted mouth, surrounded by a raised external rim. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Compare with J. Garstang, 'Tombs of the third Egyptian dynasty at Reqâqnah and Bêt Khallâf' (London, 1904), pl. XIII. Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'British Museum expedition to Middle Egypt, 1929-1931 Matmar' (London, 1948), 25 and pl. XXIII, 12.
